Description: Two joining sherds of the body of large Corinthian black-figure pottery alabastron; exterior: traces of two brown-fired bands above and below four rows of double-incised scales with incised central dots and traces of added red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the scales, see British Museum 1924,1201.1219.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 53, no. A8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.143) (Phase 1)
